org.davidmoten.hilbert

Class HilbertCurve

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.davidmoten.hilbert.HilbertCurve

  • public final class HilbertCurve
extends Object
    Converts between Hilbert index (transposed and BigInteger) and N-dimensional points. The Hilbert index is expressed as an array of transposed bits. 
      Example: 5 bits for each of n=3 coordinates.
     15-bit Hilbert integer = A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O is stored
     as its Transpose                        ^
     X[0] = A D G J M                    X[2]|  7
     X[1] = B E H K N        <------->       | /X[1]
     X[2] = C F I L O                   axes |/
            high low                         0------> X[0]

    Note: This algorithm is derived from work done by John Skilling and published in "Programming the Hilbert curve". (c) 2004 American Institute of Physics. With thanks also to Paul Chernoch who published a C# algorithm for Skilling's work on StackOverflow and GitHub).

    • Method Detail

      • bits

        public static HilbertCurve.HilbertCurveBuilder bits(int bits)
        Returns a builder for and object that performs transformations for a Hilbert curve with the given number of bits.
        Parameters:
        bits - depth of the Hilbert curve. If bits is one, this is the top-level Hilbert curve
        Returns:
        builder for object to do transformations with the Hilbert Curve
